result.execSummary:
The defendant Shamari Davon Parks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber Privileges for work and childcare.
Sign up for probation no later than October 27th, 2022.

miscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Complete a firearm safety course.
Complete 20 hours of community service.
Complete a cognitive thinking course.
Court GRANTS expungement pending the successful completion of probation.

Submit a DNA sample by October 27th, 2022 and pay the surcharge by 10/25/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept
Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 10/25/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shamari Davon Parks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shamari Davon Parks in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Shamari Davon Parks.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion the of the State, Court ordered Count 2 to be DISMISSED AND READ IN.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 2 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and childcare. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than October 27th, 2022.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
- Complete a firearm safety course.
-Complete 20 hours of community service.
-Complete a cognitive thinking course.  
- Submit a DNA sample by October 27th, 2022 and pay the surcharge by 10/25/2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges by 10/25/2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
- Court GRANTS expungement pending the successful completion of probation.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Shamari Davon Parks appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Shamari Davon Parks.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 room 623 Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Shamari Davon Parks in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Calendar Call held.  Defendant appearing in court, Court vacates previously stayed bench warrant.  Defense counsel has discovery and offer and requests additional time to review with defendant.  Case adourned, Br. 15.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shamari Davon Parks in court with Attorney Haley E Wentz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defendant does not appear.  Court set a calendar call date.  This matter will be held in person in room 623 of the Courthouse.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Calendar call scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shamari Davon Parks in court.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-30-2022 @2:30p
